author: Mason Nesbitt
title: COC football loses to Saddleback
text:
COC football loses to Saddleback No. 4 Cougars undefeated run ends at hands of No. 17 Gauchos Posted: October 11, 2015 12:06 a.m. Updated: October 11, 2015 12:06 a.m. A A A 
A slow start finally got the best of College of the Canyons football on Saturday. 
After living dangerously the last several weeks, the state No. 4-ranked Cougars never got on track in a 19-3 road loss to No. 17 Saddleback College. 
The Gauchos (4-2) led 13-0 at halftime and allowed only an Alec Chadwick 40-yard field goal to the Cougars in the second half of a contest that derailed what had been an undefeated run for COC (5-1). 
Cougars quarterback Devon Dunn completed 21-of-46 passes for 209 yards and no interceptions. 
Conner Byrnes caught nine passes for 97 yards for COC, which had started slowly in its last four wins after soundly upsetting Mt. San Antonio College in its season opener. 
Saddleback took a 6-0 lead on a Jojo Binda 7-yard run in the first quarter and extended the lead on quarterback Jacob Gibsonâ€™s 52-yard TD strike to Remy Wasserbach just before the half. 
Gibson completed 10-of-18 passes for 106 yards, two TDs and one interception. The Gauchos ran the ball 42 times for 163 yards as a team. 
Kenny Torrence ran the ball 18 times for 53 yards to lead COC, but he also lost one of two Cougars fumbles. Dunn lost the other in Saddleback territory. 
It was, however, a non-conference game. And the Cougars currently sit in a tie atop the National Division, Northern Conference at 2-0.
